prompt:
Write Python code that defines the following pandas DataFrame representing movie ratings:

import pandas as pd
data = {
    "MovieID": ["M01", "M02", "M03", "M04", "M05"],
    "Title": ["Inception", "The Dark Knight", "Pulp Fiction", "Forrest Gump", "The Matrix"],
    "Genre": ["Sci-Fi", "Action", "Crime", "Drama", "Sci-Fi"],
    "Year": [2010, 2008, 1994, 1994, 1999],
    "Rating": [8.8, 9.0, 8.9, 8.8, 8.7],
    "Votes": [2200000, 2500000, 1900000, 1800000, 1700000]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

After creating the DataFrame, the code should: 1) Print the "Title" of the movie with the highest "Rating". 2) Print the average "Year" of all movies in the list. Provide only Python code.
evaluation_criteria: Code should correctly define the DataFrame, identify the highest-rated movie by title, and calculate the average release year.
